name: RS-FLipflop
description:
An RS-Flipflop stores 1-Bit by storing the last value of the input and returning it on the next clock cycle. 
S (Set) forces the output to 1, R (Reset) forces it to **0`.
If both inputs are 0, the circuit keeps its previous value due to feedback.
This is the fundamental memory element showing how state is preserved.
objectives: Build an RS flip-flop using two NOR gates.
S = 0 and R = 0 → Q keeps its old value
Note: S = 1 and R = 1 is invalid (undefined state)
hints: Try connecting outputs of the NOR gates with inputs of the NOR gates.
Each of the given inputs, has to be connected to exactly one NOR Gate.
Connect the outputs of the NOR Gates with the remaining input on the other NOR-Gate
